definition: to terminate/to cut short/to bring to a stop/to squeeze/to tighten/to damage/variant of 殺|杀[sha1]

white/snowy/pure/bright/empty/blank/plain/clear/to make clear/in vain/gratuitous/free of charge/reactionary/anti-communist/funeral/to stare coldly/to write wrong character/to state/to explain/vernacular/spoken lines in opera

sentences.english: Gog saw the gun and his face went white.
sentences.chinese: 高格看见了那支枪，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: I unclenched my hands and looked at my fingers, white and bent.
sentences.chinese: 我靠在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: The very thought of going make her blanch.
sentences.chinese: 一想到去就使她脸色煞白。

sentences.english: He blanched at the sight of the mutilated corpse.
sentences.chinese: 他看见那具残缺不全的尸体吓得脸色煞白。

sentences.english: Thee coward was backing, his face being deathly pale, toward another room.
sentences.chinese: 那个胆小鬼向另一个房间退去，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: I unclenched my hands and looked at my fingers, white and bent.
sentences.chinese: 在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: I sat against the back of the chair and stretched my arms , I saw my fingers were so pallid and not unbent .
sentences.chinese: 我靠在椅背上，松开双手，看到手指煞白且无法伸直。

sentences.english: That was a veiled reference to the fever, and Nora paled.
sentences.chinese: 热病，那是一个借口，劳拉的脸变得煞白。

sentences.english: Horton looked up with his face white as chalk.
sentences.chinese: 可怜的霍顿脸色煞白，抬起头来。

sentences.english: He paled visibly at the mention of her name.
sentences.chinese: 一提及她的名字，他的脸明显变得煞白。

sentences.english: The blood drained from her face as she learned what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 当她得知所发生的一切时，脸色煞白。

sentences.english: She went white; I was furious.
sentences.chinese: 她脸色煞白，我怒不可遏。

sentences.english: He would have turned pale, had it been possible for him to become any paler.
sentences.chinese: 他的面色本来已经煞白，不可能变得更苍白了。

sentences.english: Nora was white when he closed the door behind him.
sentences.chinese: 他把门带上，劳拉变得煞白。

sentences.english: He raised his ghost-white fist and banged three times on the door.
sentences.chinese: 他举起煞白的拳头，在门上猛捶了三下。

definition: to turn red (in the face)/to flush (with embarrassment or anger)
very red/red through and through/to blush (deep red)
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
trill (of voice)/see also 顫聲|颤声[zhan4 sheng1]
trembling voice/see also 顫聲|颤声[chan4 sheng1]
